title: Event Marketer
description:
Meet Leaf Home, the leading provider of technology-driven home solutions that is on a mission to make homeownership easy. With more than 50% of consumers worried about the cost and effort of home maintenance, we focus on delivering remarkable, end-to-end experiences. Trusted by more than 1 million homeowners across the US and Canada, Leaf Home is America’s largest direct-to-consumer full-service provider of branded home services and products. Leaf Home and its products, including the patented LeafFilter gutter protection system, have earned numerous awards and recognition from Good Housekeeping, Qualified Remodeler, Angi, Consumer Reports, This Old House, and other consumer review platforms.

  



Powered by people, Leaf Home's innovative products and services are delivered with convenience, trust, and quality via 200+ regional sales and installation offices along with comprehensive field support offices in New York and Hudson, Ohio. We believe we win together. Leaf Home has been consistently named one of the fastest-growing private companies by Inc 5000 and recognized as a top employer nationally. The benefits of working at Leaf Home are wide-ranging and include:  



401k with company match | Employee assistance programs, including legal, financial planning, and counseling | Employee discount marketplace | Employee Resource Groups such as VetConnect, DEI Committee, Women’s Committee.  



Apply today and together we will unlock millions of customers' dream homes and your dream career at Leaf Home.

  




**Position Summary:** The Marketer represents the Leaf Home brand(s) through face-to-face interaction with prospective customers by attending a variety of pre-scheduled events throughout a designated territory. The purpose of this position is to build brand awareness and transform that awareness into a sales lead.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Attend consumer-facing shows including but not limited to home shows, fairs, festivals, and community events.
* Interact with event attendees, provide informative product demonstrations, and generate sales leads.
* Overcome objections by utilizing proven, industry-leading sales techniques and training resources.
* Transport, assemble, and disassemble lightweight display equipment and marketing collateral.
* Submit sales leads at the conclusion of each shift.
* Responsible for meeting predetermined performance goals for each event as well as other KPIs.
* Performs other duties as assigned by supervisor.


**Experience and Minimum Qualifications:**


* Part-time hours
* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Ability to actively listen and rebut objections and answer questions regarding the performance or quality of the product(s).
* Must have a smartphone to use the Company timekeeping application and submit leads.
* Must be able to stand for extended periods.
* Ability to engage attendees, obtain their interest, and present a product demonstration.
* Ability to work weekends and evenings.
* Must be outgoing, friendly, and energetic.
* Ability to juggle various work activities and shift their attention from one task to another to meet the demands of different stakeholders without “dropping the ball.”
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-energy, team-oriented environment and have a “roll up your sleeves” and “win every day” mentality.
* Hold oneself accountable and responsible while being self-driven in accomplishing goals.
* Detail-oriented and can focus on the task at hand by finding the most efficient and effective pathway to completion.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills at all levels to communicate with internal and external stakeholders articulately.
* Ability to logically connect ideas, scrutinize and evaluate arguments, find inconsistencies and errors in work, solve complex problems, and engage in reflection.
* Ability to provide timely and empathetic service through all communication channels keeping peer and customer needs first.
* Must hold a valid driver’s license.
* Must have reliable transportation to/from job site to perform job duties.
* Must be legally authorized to work in the country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).

**Preferred Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications:**


* Experience in customer service and/or sales.
* Experience in the home improvement industry.

**Travel Requirements:**


* Occasional overnight travel required.


**Overtime/Additional Hours Requirements:**


* No overtime required.


**Physical Requirements:**


* Normal Office Environment and field office/manufacturing/construction environment.
* Performs indoor work in a climate-controlled environment and performs work outside in varying temperatures and climates.
* Medium work. Exerting up to 50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or up to 30 pounds of force frequently, and/or up to 10 pounds of force constantly to move objects.

  




**Diversity and Inclusion Statement**


Leaf Home is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We strive to create an environment that embraces differences and fosters inclusion.


**Equal Opportunity Statement**


Leaf Home will recruit, hire, train, and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, religion, age, results of genetic testing, veteran status, or physical/mental disability (except where the disability prevents the individual from being able to perform the essential functions of the job and cannot be reasonably accommodated in full compliance with the law).

May include real-time problem solving with challenging installations in varying field conditions and interacting with customers.


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Work on single-person or multiple-person installations as assigned by Field Installation Lead and/or Installation management team.
* Solve onsite installation challenges through product measuring, adjustments, and customizations including use of basic hand tools and battery-operated tools.
* Travel in assigned local territory using personal vehicle (reliable truck or van) to complete assigned gutter protection installations at customer location(s).

* Ability to provide timely and empathetic service through all communication channels keeping peer and customer needs first.
* Must hold a valid driver’s license.
* Must have reliable transportation to/from job site to perform job duties.
* Must be comfortable ascending and descending ladders of varying heights to perform services.
Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).  
* 

**Preferred Knowledge, Skills, Abilities or Certifications:**


Prior experience in gutter and/or gutter protection system installation, repair, or inspection is a plus.  

* 

**Travel Requirements:**


Local travel required.  

*

title: Service Technician Apprentice
description:
LIVunLtd Service Apprentices are leaders in the fitness industry and part of a skilled team of individuals who are in control of their advancement through our technician career path and other career opportunities throughout the company.



Our Service Apprentice program is crafted to develop individuals into Service Technicians. Whereas a Service Technician, you are responsible for diagnosing, servicing, repairing, and maintaining fitness equipment while delivering world-class customer service and being a professional representative of LIVunLtd. Successful candidates must be able to manage a schedule full of jobs for a variety of demanding customers. You are the face of LIVunLtd we need the best.

 **ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES**


**Primary Responsibilities**


* Travel to client locations
* Inspect, calibrate, and clean and test fitness equipment during Service Contract visits
* Evaluate equipment for repair; prepare parts list and labor estimates for a repair quote to be provided to customer
* Complete repairs with parts ordered; test that machine is back in full working order
* Provide communication to customer both in scheduling times to come out and what is going on with their equipment
* Look for additional opportunities for revenue from service/warranty work and PM contracts on additional machines
* Look for additional opportunities for incremental revenue for new equipment and/or fitness accessories

 **Additional Responsibilities**


* Maintain a clean and organized company vehicle at all times
* Maintain proper inventory levels and count accuracy at all times
* Complete vehicle maintenance needs as directed by the fleet operations manager
* Follow with Company Uniform Policy

 **SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS**


* Be able to lift/move fitness equipment & parts to 50 lbs, some in excess of 125 lbs.
* Ability to operate hand and power tools
* Maintain a valid driver’s license and insurance and clear an MVR Check.
* Must have excellent work habits, be punctual and presentable at all times
* Proficiency and working knowledge of computers, Microsoft OS, iPad, wifi, email and cell phone technology
* Excitement to build a career as a Service Technician

 **BENEFITS**


As a member of LIVunLtd you can expect:





* Growth opportunities
* A fun, friendly, professional working environment
* Health Benefits, Dental Benefits, Vision Benefits, 401K Benefits
* Company Vehicle, Gas Card, Vehicle Maintenance, Parking Expense Card, Company Phone, Company iPad

  

LIVunLtd is an equal opportunity employer. We have employed and surrounded ourselves with the top talent in the industry, and constantly focus on innovation and growth for the company and our culture. Other job-related duties may be assigned and could require work outside of duties listed. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit our website. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. title: Aqua Fitness & Swim Instructor
description:
LIVunLtd is currently seeking experienced, energetic and exceptional Aqua Fitness & Swim Instructors to join our growing team! As an Aqua Fitness & Swim Instructor you are experienced, positive, and patient. LIVunLtd Aqua Fitness & Swim Instructors are expected to educate, motivate, and make swimming a fun experience while they teach. Whether it be on a weekly or daily basis, Instructors are expected to provide an encouraging voice and energetic personality when leading exercise activities.

 **ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Create an educational, safe, and inviting experience for all participants.
* Possess a strong set of customer service skills and the passion to work with children, adults, and families.
* Ensure instructional equipment remains in good condition; have all equipment ready prior to classes and put away after.
* Guarantee safety at all times and provide first aid when necessary.
* Perform any and all cleaning duties as assigned to help establish and maintain showroom quality at all times.
* Enforce all company policies procedures in efforts to maintain a quiet, safe and secure environment for members.
* Adhere and adapt to all current and new LIVunLtd policies, procedures and initiatives.
* Report any unsafe conditions or situations that require attention to the Fitness + Wellness Director.
* Wear building-approved uniform for each specific location where you are working.


**SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS**


* Minimum one year experience as a swim instructor required.
* Experience teaching Aqua Fitness.
* Current CPR / AED and Water Safety Instructor (WSI) certifications.
* Ability to react calmly and effectively in emergency situations.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Must be an organized and customer service oriented.
* Must be willing to travel throughout the NY Metro Area to provide swim lessons.


**BENEFITS**



As a Member of the LIVunLtd Team you can expect


* Growth opportunities
* A fun, friendly, professional working environment
* Competitive compensation within industry standards


**COMPENSATION**



The Aqua Fitness & Swim Instructor position with LIVunLtd pays minimum wage aligned with state regulations for corporate education and development initiatives. This position pays a minimum of $70.00 per fitness group fitness class. Rates are subject to change based upon work location.

  

LIVunLtd is committed to the safety and well-being of our employees, vendors, and clients. We are following regional and contractual guidelines that mandate COVID-19 vaccination and testing requirements.

  

This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department. LIVunLtd is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit our website. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

title: Office Cleaner/Cleaning Position
company: Above N' Beyond Office Cleaning, LLC
description:
PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DON'T DRIVE YOUR OWN AUTOMOBILE AND LIVE WITHIN A 10 MINUTE DRIVE TO INWOOD

POR FAVOR, NO SOLICITE SI NO CONDUCE SU PROPIO AUTOMÓVIL Y VIVE A 10 MINUTOS EN CONDUCCIÓN DE INWOOD

Cronograma:

De lunes a viernes de 5pm a 7pm (a tu elección) y trabajando aproximadamente 5 horas por noche. Sábados y domingos a partir de las 330 p. m. y trabajando aproximadamente 3 horas cada día.

Por favor responda por CORREO ELECTRÓNICO e incluya:

--- NOMBRE COMPLETO

--- PUEBLO EN EL QUE VIVES

--- NÚMERO CELULAR

--- Currículum (si está disponible)

--- Dirección de correo electrónico

--- Referencias que puedas tener

Calificaciones:

DEBE TENER AUTOMÓVIL PROPIO.

Se prefiere hablar inglés pero no es obligatorio.

Debe poder levantar al menos 30 libras.

Responsabilidades:

- Realizar tareas de limpieza rutinarias como quitar el polvo, barrer, trapear y pasar la aspiradora.

- Vaciar los contenedores de basura y reemplazar las bolsas.

- Limpiar y desinfectar los baños, incluidos inodoros, lavabos y accesorios.

- Recargar dispensadores de jabón y reponer productos de papel.

- Limpiar ventanas, superficies de vidrio y espejos.

- Mantener un inventario de suministros de limpieza y notificar al supervisor cuando sea necesario reponer los suministros.

- Seguir todos los protocolos de seguridad y utilizar equipos de protección personal (EPI) adecuados.

- Adherirse a las políticas y procedimientos de la empresa con respecto a los estándares de limpieza y saneamiento.

Requisitos:

- Se prefiere, pero no es obligatorio, experiencia previa en limpieza comercial o trabajos de conserjería.

- Capacidad para operar equipos de limpieza industrial de forma segura y eficaz.

- Gran atención al detalle y capacidad para seguir instrucciones.

- Buena resistencia física y capacidad para realizar tareas repetitivas durante largos períodos de tiempo.

- Excelentes habilidades de gestión del tiempo para garantizar que las tareas se completen dentro de los plazos designados.

Schedule:

Monday to Friday starting between 5pm to 7pm (your choice) and working approximately 5 hours per night. Saturdays and Sundays starting anytime after 330pm and working approximately 3 hours each day.

Please reply by EMAIL and include:

--- FULL NAME

--- TOWN YOU LIVE IN

--- CELL PHONE NUMBER

--- Resume (if available)

--- Email address

--- References you may have

Qualifications:

MUST HAVE OWN AUTOMOBILE.

English speaking preferred but not mandatory.

Must be able to lift at least 30 pounds.

Responsibilities: - Perform routine cleaning tasks such as dusting, sweeping, mopping, and vacuuming - Empty trash receptacles and replace liners - Clean and sanitize restrooms, including toilets, sinks, and fixtures - Refill soap dispensers and restock paper products - Clean windows, glass surfaces, and mirrors - Maintain inventory of cleaning supplies and notify supervisor when supplies need to be replenished - Follow all safety protocols and use appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) - Adhere to company policies and procedures regarding cleanliness and sanitation standards

Requirements: - Previous experience in commercial cleaning or custodial work preferred but not mandatory - Ability to operate industrial cleaning equipment safely and effectively - Strong attention to detail and ability to follow instructions - Good physical stamina and ability to perform repetitive tasks for extended periods of time - Excellent time management skills to ensure tasks are completed within designated timeframes

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 - $19.00 per hour

Expected hours: 32 – 34 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid training

Physical Setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* Evening shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Location:

* Inwood, NY (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Account Manager
description:
Location: East Coast Region (Remote with Travel)
**Company Overview:**
NuFlow Technologies is a leading provider of Cured In Place Pipe (CIPP) lining solutions, headquartered in San Diego, CA. We specialize in advanced trenchless technology that rehabilitates existing pipelines without the need for disruptive excavation. Our commitment to quality, innovation, and customer satisfaction has made us a trusted partner in the infrastructure and utility sectors.
**Position Overview:**
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced **East Coast Account Manager** to join our team. This role is pivotal in expanding our presence in the **East Coast** market, fostering strong relationships with clients, and driving continued growth of our contractor network. The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated professional with a proven track record in sales and account management, preferably within the construction or infrastructure industry.
**Key Responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute strategic sales plans to achieve sales targets and expand our customer/contractor base on the East Coast.
* Identify and engage with potential contractors through research, cold calling, email campaigns, etc.
* Build and maintain strong, long-lasting customer relationships by understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
* Conduct presentations, product demonstrations, and training sessions for clients.
* Collaborate with the technical team to ensure customer satisfaction and successful project delivery.
* Monitor market trends, competitor activities, and industry developments to identify new business opportunities.
* Prepare and deliver sales reports, forecasts, and market analysis to senior management.
* Attend industry conferences, trade shows, and networking events to promote our services and build brand awareness.


**Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in sales or account management, preferably in the construction, infrastructure, or related industries.
* Proven success in developing and managing client relationships.
* Strong understanding of CIPP lining technology and trenchless rehabilitation methods is a plus.
* Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
* Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and prioritize tasks.
* Willingness to travel extensively within the East Coast region.
* Proficiency in CRM (NetSuite) software and Microsoft Office Suite.

title: Major Market Sales Executive, Field - Manhattan
description:
**Major Market Sales Executive, Field**
**Manhattan Territory**
Paycor empowers leaders to develop winning teams. Our Human Capital Management (HCM) software modernizes every aspect of People Management from the way you recruit, onboard, develop, pay, and retain employees. Best of all? Our team is growing, and there has never been a better time to join! If you love to Think Big, Dream Big, Compete to Win, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you!

Job Summary
The Major Market Sales Executive, Field identifies potential clients through prospecting activities, consults with the potential clients to identify which Paycor products and services will solve their business challenges, and ultimately sells those solutions to new clients within assigned territories. He or she is responsible for self-generating leads through prospecting, telemarketing, sales database management (CRM), and networking. The Major Market Sales Executive, Field is an expert in our sales process and product offering and is accountable for forecasting their sales on a monthly basis. He or she is a self-starter who is responsible for achieving assigned monthly and annual sales quotas.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
* Identify potential clients in the higher employee band and more complex end of the midmarket space through prospecting and referrals, and while leveraging tools and technology.
* Consult with potential clients to determine the optimal solutions to solve business challenges and accommodate specific business needs.
* Call on potential clients in person and by phone to present Paycor products and services.
* Develop and maintain excellent relationships with assigned referral sources.
* Ownership of individual accurate monthly and quarterly forecasts.
* Analyze current practices of potential clients and identify additional sales opportunities.
* Meet or exceed agreed-upon sales activity and sales targets.
* Assist in the conversion process for new clients, including submission of complete paperwork for new clients and the successful processing of the initial payroll.
* Work closely with Client Services staff to achieve client satisfaction.
* Record all sales activity and results in SFDC in a timely manner, preferably daily.
* Work closely with Client Services and Implementation team to support effective new client implementation and transition.
* Complete regular reports as required, including CRM updates.
* On an as-needed basis, assist RSD in the development of less experienced Sales Executives.
* Demonstrate a strong work ethic and regular attendance.
* Maintain ethical business practices.
* Other duties as assigned.


Requirements
*To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.*
* 3-6 years experience in consultative, B2B sales with a proven track record of success
* Able to excel in a fast-paced work environment without direct daily supervision
* Excellent interpersonal, communication, presentation, and organizational skills
* Strong mathematical aptitude and problem-solving skills
* 4-year business degree

Paycor Total Rewards
We are proud to provide best-in-class benefits delivering a personal and professional experience that meets you where it matters most - the well-being of you and your loved ones.
Highlights include:
* A flexible virtual-first work philosophy
* An initial equity award in Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) for all new Associates and ongoing award opportunities to participate in the value created through Paycor's growth
* 401(k) with a $.65 match for every dollar contributed up to 6% of eligible pay
* Generous paid time off in addition to 10 paid holidays (including YOUR Holiday to celebrate a day or holiday you hold special)
* Three medical plan options – including a $0 cost option and travel & lodging support to ensure access to medical care
* Paid leave for birth parents, non-birth parents, elder caregivers, and military support
* Sabbatical opportunities for tenured Associates
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan, which enables you to buy PYCR stock at a 15% discount
* Inclusive and accessible Employee Assistance Program (EAP) to help with everyday challenges

We also offer competitive compensation determined by each individual's relevant experience, skills, and education. We anticipate the base pay for this position to be between $65,000 - $115,000. In addition to base pay, Paycor Associates are eligible for either a performance-based annual bonus or commission, depending on their position. If your desired salary falls outside of these rates, we hope you'll still apply as there may be other positions that better align.
For more information about our total rewards, please visit www.mypaycorbenefits.com.
If you need assistance or accommodation during the interview process due to a disability, please email us at interviewaccommodations@paycor.com. *This information will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of determining an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.*

title: Insurance Account Manager - Personal Lines Property and Casualty
description:

title: Finance Admin Assistant
description:
**About us:** iconic brand, tiny company.

  

Polaroid was founded in 1937 by one of the most seminal innovators of the 20th century, Edwin Land. His motto was, “don't undertake a project unless it is manifestly important and nearly impossible.” In 2008, Polaroid shuttered its last factory, but a group of diehard fans came together as The Impossible Project to save instant film. Over 10 years later that startup acquired what was left of Polaroid and today we’re again a small group of people passionate about changing the world through great products.

 **Role description**

  

The Finance Admin Assistant will provide support to the Accounting Manager, and the Finance Associate. The primary areas of support are, Accounts Payable, Cash Application, and Office Administration. The Secondary area of support is assisting with the disputing of customer violations (chargebacks).

 **Objectives of the role**

  

Accurate and timely processing of all Accounts Payable transactions



Timely payment application of wholesale and direct sale payments


Effective administration of office including maintenance and planning



Consistent, timely and pro-active support to the team as needed  



  

**Primary Duties**

  

Process Accounts payable transactions and ensure accurate coding and collection of approvals of invoices in ERP system


Perform Accounts Payable duties such as account maintenance, reconciliation, collecting, scanning, and filing supporting documentation



Expense report collection and processing, ensuring accurate coding and collection of receipts



Apply complex wholesale payments according to the customer remittance advice



Accurately code any payment discrepancies and/or Chargebacks



Apply direct sale payments from PayPal, Shopify and Amazon seller portals



Reconcile and post discrepancies and month-end accruals for Direct Sales transactions



Coordinate office maintenance and event coordination liaising with all departments


Provide support to Accounting Manager and AR Manager with customer and vendor inquiries and reporting

 **Competencies**

  

Attention to detail as well as the wider consequences of errors in financial data entry



Intermediate Excel ability, analytical skills, methodical approach and problem-solving skills



Organisational and strong time management skills



Teamworking, communication and interpersonal skills



Self-motivation, integrity, self-awareness  



  

**Qualifications/experience required**

  

1 year + experience with Administrative and clerical tasks



Extremely competent with Microsoft Excel and office suite

  


Excellent communication and organizational skills



Ability to be pro-active with a sense of urgency



Must possess the ability to work without direct supervision, and efficiently manage tasks and time



Display a positive and pro-active attitude

  

Find out more about our applicant privacy policy here:



https://www.polaroid.com/careers-job-applicant-privacy-policy
